headline: Addicted to Your Smartphone? The Company That Made It Would Like You to Think So.

snippet: When the deal for Verizon to buy AOL was announced last month, executives from both companies said AOL was an appealing acquisition because of its advertising technology. On Monday, AOL showed some of that value in announcing a deal with Microsoft
headline: Daily Report: AOL to Take Over Display Advertising for Microsoft

snippet: AOL will take over management and sales of display, mobile and video advertising that appears on Xbox, Skype and other Microsoft products in several countries.
headline: AOL in Deal With Microsoft to Take Over Display Ad Business

snippet: Financial reports are expected from Twitter and Facebook, along with earnings reports from big oil and confidence and growth measures from the United States.

snippet: Facebook and other leading American technology companies see Africa as a place to experiment with new ways of expanding Internet access.
headline: Facebook and Other Tech Giants Expand Internet Access in Africa

snippet: The ride-hailing company further bolsters its mapping technology and engineering bench.
headline: Uber to Acquire Mapping Technology and Know-How From Microsoft

snippet: Mr. Myerson, who already led one of the largest software organizations in the world in Microsoft’s operating systems group, takes on a division that has been troubled in recent years.
headline: Terry Myerson Rises to Powerful New Role in Charge of Microsoft Devices

snippet: Executives said that people who own the Xbox One will be able to play many games originally created for the previous console, the Xbox 360.
headline: Xbox One to Get ‘Backward Compatibility,’ Microsoft Says at E3

snippet: Buying the cloud-based customer-service software could make businesses less likely to ditch Office. It might, however, cost Microsoft some $60 billion.

snippet: Microsoft's new operating system runs across all platforms from PCs to mobile devices. But an analyst says it won't pull users away from iPhones. Fred Katayama reports.

snippet: Almost six months after Microsoft sued Samsung, accusing it of violating the terms of a patent licensing agreement, the two companies on Monday said they had settled their feud.
headline: Microsoft and Samsung End Legal Dispute

snippet: The European Union is accusing Google of abusing its dominance, and Microsoft has links with the three initial complainants that sparked the antitrust investigation.
headline: Microsoft, Once an Antitrust Target, Is Now Google’s Regulatory Scold

snippet: Microsoft notched several deals with Chinese companies to push Windows. It'll even replace its Bing search engine with Baidu in China. Fred Katayama reports.
headline: Microsoft drops Bing in China

snippet: Microsoft has launched a new flagship store on Fifth Avenue in New York City. It's ramping up efforts to promote new products, including its first laptop. Bobbi Rebell reports.
headline: Microsoft's posh retail bet
